structure.unit: COUNTY ROAD ENGINEER AND MAINTENANCE OF PUBLIC ROADS

law.catch_line: Payment of damages for engineer's entry upon private lands.

text.section: When lands are entered upon under the provisions of KRS 179.300, the county engineer may agree with the owner of the lands subject to the approval of the fiscal court, as to the amount of damages sustained by the owner because of the entry, and the amount of damages shall be paid by the fiscal court out of the county road fund.
If the county engineer is unable to agree with the owner upon the amount of the damages, the amount shall be determined and paid in the manner provided in KRS 178.110.

law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4353.
